comments.author: Jeff Dever
comments.body:
There has been a steady flow of examples added to the repository.  There is
enough there now, but more examples are always welcome.

The examples are currently not being build with a normal build.  This should be
done next to ensure the examples stay up to date.

comments.body:

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Jandalf
What samples are still missing in your opinion? Will build.xml update to include
exampes into compilation process be enough to close this bug?

Oleg

comments.author: Jeff Dever
comments.body: The only issue left is to make the required change to build.xml

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=5369)
Compilation process to include examples & unsupported components

comments.author: Aaron Cure
comments.body:
I would like to see an example that connects to a page (i.e. 
http://cgi1.ebay.com/aw-cgi/eBayISAPI.dll?MyEbayLogin ) download the login page 
and cookies, submit the form back to the server, and get the resulting page.  
No graphical client, no swing libraries, just a simple connect, get the page, 
submit the page, get the result.

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Requested sample has been added

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs/jakarta-commons/httpclient/src/examples/FormLoginDemo.java

Oleg

description:
- better project samples showing how to use HttpClient in a variety of ways. 
There is already a src/examples directory which is excellent.  Its in the right
place and should be build with a full compile, if only to know how any API
changes may effect example code, and that we will be required to keep them
current.
- make sure it uses the 2.0 API and no depricated methods!
